intro: Phaulopsis barteri var. barteri, commonly known as the Barter's phaulopsis, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of South America. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and other tropical plants. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It is adapted to thrive in dry, sandy soils and requires minimal water once established. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for xeriscaping in drought-prone areas.
